channel.title: Getting a guitar soon though. Need your opinions
channel.description:
I'm getting a guitar soon pretty soon. But i'm on an extremely tight budget because my parents can't afford one, so I don't have much to work with. I have $120 to spend. What do you guys recommend for beginners? Acoustic or electric? Also what brands would you suggest, I want a quality built guitar, something that'll last me a couple years or until I can afford a much better one.
I had my eye on a basic Fender if I decide to go electric.

item.title: Getting a guitar soon though. Need your opinions
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:5, topic:408907”]Get an acoustic, because there’s no way $120 will be enough for both an amp and a guitar. I’ve had my acoustic for a bit over two years now, and I bought it used so all in all it should be around 4-5 years old, assuming I remember the details the seller told me correctly.

http://www.jandd-guitars.com/c-26.htm

I really like it and the sound is rich as long as you have good quality strings.[/quote]
I paid about $150 for an amp and guitar once. They both sit in my closet gathering dust because they’re absolutely terrible and no one will buy them.

If you’re only able to spend $120, but an acoustic. If you can, put that money away and save for a decent electric guitar and amp. I have an Epiphone Les Paul, and a Fender Mustang amp, both are great and about $500 together iirc.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting a guitar soon though. Need your opinions

item.title: Getting a guitar soon though. Need your opinions
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:14, topic:408907”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=510190.msg3707398#msg3707398 date=1313116684]

You can’t go wrong with Fender. Their quality is amazing. Also the Standard Strats and Teles (Made in Mexico of course) there quality has raised tremendously over the past 3 years. Now they’re wonderful guitars. As close to the real thing as you can get.

He’s got 120$ and needs an amp. He’ll end up with a squier.

You might be able to get that for $120 if it’s used. The guitar itself is $120.
[/quote]
No I got both guitar and amp new for 100$[/quote]

Fender has raised all of there prices pretty recently.

item.title: Getting a guitar soon though. Need your opinions
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Javerfire:

THESE ARE THE BEST GUITARS AVAILABLE however they’re somewhat expensive depending on the model.

Schecter guitar’s are amazing. I own the C-1 Standard and it’s one of the best guitar’s I have ever played, and it was only $550! It’s better than a Standard Strat in my opinion, but an American Start or Tele beat’s it. I want the 35th Anniversary C-1. :[

item.title: Getting a guitar soon though. Need your opinions
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Yeah, with $120 you’re not going to be able to find a gutiar AND an amp. Although, Fender has this begginger package that is around $200 and it’s what I started out with. It’s pretty good honestly. For $200 anyways. You get a small Fender Squire SP-10 and a Fender Squire SE, along with a guitar strap, case, cable, and a tuner.

http://www.guitarcenter.com/Fender-SE-Special-Strat-with-Squier-SP-10-Amp-Value-Pack-104486238-i1177837.gc

Or you could look at just the guitar which is $120 but you will need to find an amp to stick it into, of course:

Guitar Center

Squier Bullet Strat with Tremolo

Shop for the Squier Bullet Strat with Tremolo in Black and receive free shipping and guaranteed lowest price.

Speljohan:

Gibson SG.

Bleh. Gibson’s (and obviously Ephiphone’s) quality in the resent year has plummeted tremendously.

Read full topic

I really like it and the sound is rich as long as you have good quality strings.

item.title: Getting a guitar soon though. Need your opinions
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I’ve had a Fender Squire Bullet Strat in black for like four years and it’s been alright I guess. It’s perfect for beginners that wish to experiment with a variety of styles and it really is dirt cheap.

Just found http://www.amazon.com/Squier-Fender-BulletStrat-Arctic-White/dp/B001L8MB3O
Falls right into your budget and come on, ITS ARTIC WHITE!!!

item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

my first guitar is a fender cd-60 its acoustic works great havent had any probs cost me $300 and i had to pay for it aswell so i would suggest doing your research like i did look at guitars on their site then look at peoples reveiws on other sites for that certain model
